intro: Heliotropium greggii, commonly known as Gregg's heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that are typically clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Heliotropium greggii thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to desert conditions.
